meanings.definition: To wash or leach out soluble constituents from soil or rock.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the water will eluviate the nutrients into the soil.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a special solution to eluviate the minerals from the rock sample.
meanings.sent3: The river decided to eluviate all the dirt from its path, leaving a clean trail behind.
meanings.sent4: Her tears seemed to eluviate all the pain and sorrow from her heart.
meanings.sent5: The gentle stream continued to eluviate the sediment, creating a smooth riverbed.

meanings.definition: To remove or separate fine particles from a mixture.
meanings.sent1: To make the drink clear, you need to eluviate the sugar crystals from the solution.
meanings.sent2: The filter will eluviate the impurities from the liquid, leaving it pure.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to eluviate the spices from the dish to make it milder.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to eluviate all the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind helped to eluviate the sand particles, creating a clear view of the ocean.

meanings.definition: The process of soil formation by the washing out of fine particles.
meanings.sent1: Eluviation is an important factor in the creation of fertile soil.
meanings.sent2: The eluviation of minerals contributes to the richness of the earth's crust.
meanings.sent3: The eluviation of nutrients from the topsoil helps plants grow healthily.
meanings.sent4: The eluviation of sand and clay formed layers of soil over time.
meanings.sent5: The eluviation process can take thousands of years to transform rocks into fertile land.
